required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Exercise Training Programm for Physiotherapy Students
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of an Exercise Training Programm on Mental and Anatomical Characteristics of Physiotherapy Students - a Randomized Controlled Trial

lead_sponsor.agency: THIM - die internationale Hochschule für Physiotherapie

clinical_study.source: THIM - die internationale Hochschule für Physiotherapie

brief_summary.textblock: In this study, i.e. randomized controlled trial, the effect of an exercise training program on mental and anatomical characteristics of physiotherapy students is measured.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline attention and concentration at 4 weeks (objective)
Change from baseline attention and concentration at 4 weeks (subjective)
primary_outcome.description: Participants fill out a questionnaire about attention, concentration and learning ability. There are five possible answers for each item from 1 (completely disagree) to 5 (completely agree).

primary_outcome.measure: M360 - physiological parameter of the spine
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline position and mobility of the spine at 4 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Participants are measured in different positions (upright, flexion, extension; measured in degrees) to assess position, stability and mobility of the spine. The M360 will be guided along the back and the data will be collected electronically (https://www.idiag.ch/idiag-m360/).

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline pain (back) at 4 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Participants can use this scale to classify their pain from "No pain" and "Maximum pain imaginable" by means of a slider.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline physical well-being at 4 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Participants fill out a questionnaire with 58 questions. Each question has five possible answers from 0 (completely disagree) to 4 (completely agree). The highter the score the better the actual physical well-being.

intervention.description: 10min of coordination and strength training (2-3x per week) during 2-6 weeks

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- age ≥18
- signed consent
- THIM student
- good health status
Exclusion Criteria:
- alcohol
- drugs
- smoking
